tone_rules.violence: implied or off-screen; keep Teen/PG-13 in phrasing

mire_of_thorns.mood: bog with thorn-vines that drink whispers

ink_of_concord.effect: any oath written with it cannot be broken without a price
ink_of_concord.price: the writer loses a cherished memory

lantern_of_second_dawn.effect: reveals the truth behind illusions at sunrise
lantern_of_second_dawn.price: owner never dreams again while it is kept

curses.salt_tongue: speak only in truths when bell tolls are heard
curses.ashen_mark: a sigil that burns when an oath is near breaking

starter_hooks.title: Bells in the Fog
starter_hooks.blurb: Low tide reveals a sunken bell tower near Gloamreach. Each toll rewrites a name on the village memorial.

starter_hooks.title: The Last Oathkeeper
starter_hooks.blurb: An aged monk from the Sunless Abbey seeks a courier for a vow sealed in living ink.

starter_hooks.title: Lanterns for the Dead
starter_hooks.blurb: The Lantern Guild pays well to escort a shipment through the Waking Forest where lights appear that weren’t lit.

starter_hooks.title: White Sigils, Black Debts
starter_hooks.blurb: A Pale Court heir offers protection if you recover a ledger that should have burned decades ago.

starter_hooks.title: Drowned Star’s Whisper
starter_hooks.blurb: Freshwater wells taste of salt; villagers dream of distant bells and forget their children’s names at dawn.

starter_hooks.title: Veilbound Audit
starter_hooks.blurb: The Inquisition arrives to inventory forbidden relics—and one looks suspiciously like your family keepsake.
